intro: Verbesina leivae, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy structure. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Verbesina leivae is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of Hawaii and is considered an important part of the local flora.
